Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student may be able to draw a basic shape representing a plant, such as a vertical line with something resembling leaves (limited understanding of plant structure).
The student might include some color to differentiate parts of the drawing, though inconsistently (student uses color for personal preference rather than to indicate plant health).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to show an accurate representation of a healthy, well-watered plant versus a wilting one (student may not understand what wilting looks like).
The student probably cannot illustrate patterns or differences between plants with and without water (student does not grasp the concept of water affecting plant health).
The student may misunderstand the necessity of water for plant growth and living (student might think plants look the same regardless of water).
The student might ignore common signs of unhealthy plants, such as yellowing leaves or drooping stems (student lacks awareness of these indicators).
